tests.test_body:
283: public void testBackslashEscaping() throws IOException {
284: 285: // To avoid confusion over the need for escaping chars in java code,
286: // We will test with a forward slash as the escape char, and a single
287: // quote as the encapsulator.
288: 289: final String code =
290: "one,two,three\n" // 0
291: + "'',''\n"       // 1) empty encapsulators
292: + "/',/'\n"       // 2) single encapsulators
293: + "'/'','/''\n"   // 3) single encapsulators encapsulated via escape
294: + "'''',''''\n"   // 4) single encapsulators encapsulated via doubling
295: + "/,,/,\n"       // 5) separator escaped
296: + "//,//\n"       // 6) escape escaped
297: + "'//','//'\n"   // 7) escape escaped in encapsulation
298: + "   8   ,   \"quoted \"\" /\" // string\"   \n"     // don't eat spaces
299: + "9,   /\n   \n"  // escaped newline
300: + "";
301: final String[][] res = {
302: {"one", "two", "three"}, // 0
303: {"", ""},                // 1
304: {"'", "'"},              // 2
305: {"'", "'"},              // 3
306: {"'", "'"},              // 4
307: {",", ","},              // 5
308: {"/", "/"},              // 6
309: {"/", "/"},              // 7
310: {"   8   ", "   \"quoted \"\" /\" / string\"   "},
311: {"9", "   \n   "},
312: };
313: 314: 315: final CSVFormat format = CSVFormat.newBuilder(',').withQuoteChar('\'').withEscape('/')
316: .withIgnoreEmptyLines(true).withRecordSeparator(CRLF).build();
317: 318: final CSVParser parser = new CSVParser(code, format);
319: final List<CSVRecord> records = parser.getRecords();
320: assertTrue(records.size() > 0);
321: 322: Utils.compare("Records do not match expected result", res, records);
323: }
